intro: Tocoyena velutina, commonly known as the velvet tocoyena, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in summer. Tocoyena velutina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils.
